metadata.title: FA Remember 29 05

config.question: Which candidate benefited from the support of African American voters in California, Ohio, and Illinois in the 1948 election?

answer_2.response: Consider This: The African American vote in Los Angeles, Cleveland, and Chicago ensured the Democratic victory in California, Ohio, and Illinois. Once elected, this president, though unable to secure significant legislation, made civil rights an integral part of the Democratic reform program, used his executive power to assist African Americans, and ordered desegregation of the armed forces. See L.O. 29.3 The Struggle over Civil Rights.
